intro: Rendlia obtusifolia, commonly known as the blunt-leaf rendlia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves with a rounded base. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
